e4: Adopting the new policy would align with ethical standards and legal guidelines, promoting transparency and trust. While there may be initial market adjustments and confusion among some investors, clear communication about the change can mitigate these issues. Over time, accurate and truthful reporting is fundamental to sustaining investor confidence and maintaining a favorable corporate reputation, which is critical for long-term success.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, clarity, and accessibility to all stakeholders. It must comply with legal standards and be consistent over time to avoid misleading any investor segment. Additionally, transparency in communication about any changes in reporting standards is crucial to ensure that all investors, regardless of sophistication level, can understand and trust the reported figures. Consideration should also be given to how changes in policy might be perceived and the potential impact on less informed investors.
e6: How will the management ensure all investors are adequately informed about the change in policy? What strategies will be used to mitigate any short-term negative impacts on stock prices due to misunderstandings about the new policy? Are there projections on how this shift might affect investor relations and stock performance in the long term?
